revised_title: Phytoalexins: Their Roles and Potential in Plant Disease Resistance
tldr: This article discusses the concept of phytoalexins, which are antimicrobial compounds produced by plants in response to cellular damage. Phytoalexins have different chemical structures depending on the plant family and can play a role in disease resistance. The author reviews various phytoalexins found in plants, their accumulation, and their effects on pathogens. The term "phytoalexin" should be used to describe anti-microbial substances formed in infected plants, and future research should focus on understanding their roles in disease resistance.
